newsitem.title: RUSSIA: China's Jiang flies home after Moscow visit.
newsitem.headline: China's Jiang flies home after Moscow visit.

text.p: Chinese President Jiang Zemin flew home on Saturday after a four-day visit to Russia during which he signed a treaty with President Boris Yeltsin and the presidents of Kazakhstan, Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan on cutting troop levels along the old Sino-Soviet border.

Yeltsin and Jiang also issued a declaration outlining their vision of the post-Cold War world and opposition to claims by any country for world leadership -- a clear, albeit implicit, reference to the United States.

Moscow and Beijing see both the treaty and the declaration as part of their new relationship of "partnership aimed at strategic cooperation in the 21st century," but both sides ruled out any closer union.
Yeltsin left Moscow on Thursday for the Black Sea resort of Sochi to resume a holiday he broke off to meet Jiang. Yeltsin, 66, is expected to return to Moscow on May 4.
Jiang was seen off on Saturday at Moscow's Vnukovo-2 government airport by Prime Minister Viktor Chernomyrdin.
